0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Onychomycosis due to dermatophyte: 1 g ORALLY once a day for at least 4 months (fingernails) or at least 6 months (toenails)
  • Tinea barbae: 500 mg ORALLY once a day until infection has cleared
  • Tinea capitis: 500 mg ORALLY once a day for 4 to 6 weeks
  • Tinea corporis: 500 mg ORALLY once a day for 2 to 4 weeks
  • Tinea cruris: 500 mg ORALLY once a day until infection has cleared
  • Tinea pedis: 1 g ORALLY once a day for 4 to 8 weeks

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Onychomycosis due to dermatophyte: (30 to 50 pounds) 125 to 250 mg ORALLY once daily for at least 4 months (fingernails) or at least 6 months (toenails)
  • Onychomycosis due to dermatophyte: (greater than 50 pounds) 250 to 500 mg ORALLY once daily for at least 4 months (fingernails) or at least 6 months (toenails)
  • Tinea barbae: (30 to 50 pounds) 125 to 250 mg ORALLY once daily until infection has cleared
  • Tinea barbae: (greater than 50 pounds) 250 to 500 mg ORALLY once daily until infection has cleared
  • Tinea capitis: (30 to 50 pounds) 125 to 250 mg ORALLY once daily for 4 to 6 weeks
  • Tinea capitis: (greater than 50 pounds) 250 to 500 mg ORALLY once daily for 4 to 6 weeks
  • Tinea corporis: (30 to 50 pounds) 125 to 250 mg ORALLY once daily for 2 to 4 weeks
  • Tinea corporis: (greater than 50 pounds) 250 to 500 mg ORALLY once daily for 2 to 4 weeks
  • Tinea cruris: (30 to 50 pounds) 125 to 250 mg ORALLY once daily until infection has cleared
  • Tinea cruris: (greater than 50 pounds) 250 to 500 mg ORALLY once daily until infection has cleared
  • Tinea pedis: (30 to 50 pounds) 125 to 250 mg ORALLY once daily for 4 to 8 weeks
  • Tinea pedis: (greater than 50 pounds) 250 to 500 mg ORALLY once daily for 4 to 8 weeks

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Onychomycosis due to dermatophyte
  • Tinea barbae
  • Tinea capitis
  • Tinea corporis
  • Tinea cruris
  • Tinea pedis
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Lichen planus, Cutaneous

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to griseofulvin products
  • patients with porphyria and hepatocellular failure
  • pregnancy or intention to become pregnant within 1 month of stopping therapy

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• additional contraceptive precautions should be taken during therapy and for 1 month following therapy
  • males should wait at least 6 months after therapy before fathering a child
  • history of penicillin allergy
  • photosensitivity; avoid excessive exposure to sunlight

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• Griseofulvin: WHO: WHO documentation states insufficient data.
  • Griseofulvin: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Griseofulvin is a fungistatic antibiotic that systemically inhibits fungal growth by depositing the in the keratin and exfoliation of the infected tissue.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Oral: time to peak concentration, about 4 h
  • Effect of food: better blood levels with a high fat meal

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • may take after a meal with high fat content to achieve better blood levels
  • (suspension) shake well before measuring dose

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• negative culture or improvement of clinical signs and symptoms of infection
  • hematopoietic, hepatic and renal function with prolonged therapy

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Generic
    • Oral Capsule: 250 MG
    • Oral Suspension: 125 MG/5 ML
    • Oral Tablet: 250 MG, 500 MG
  • Grifulvin V
    • Oral Suspension: 125 MG/5 ML
    • Oral Tablet: 500 MG

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Drug may cause sun-sensitivity. Advise patient to use sunscreen and avoid tanning beds.
  • Adverse effects to a fetus may be caused by either male or female patients receiving treatment with this drug. Emphasize the use of reliable contraception to patient. This applies during treatment and up to 1 month post therapy for women and 6 months post therapy for men.
  • This drug may cause rash, urticaria, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, or headache.
  • Patient should take drug after a meal with a high fat content.
